title: AHA Scientific Statement 2024: Cardiac Contributions to Brain Health

recommendations.text: Heart failure is associated with increased stroke risk and high prevalence of silent brain infarction; cardioembolism is a common subtype.
Cognitive impairment in HFrEF is linked to reduced cerebral blood flow and neurohormonal/inflammatory pathways.
Screen for cognitive impairment before advanced HF interventions (e.g., mechanical support or transplant).
AF is associated with increased risk of cognitive impairment and dementia; anticoagulation reduces dementia risk in AF.
Subclinical AF is common; wearables and implantable devices improve detection and may refine brain health risk estimates.
CHA2DS2-VASc is associated with dementia risk; AF burden may contribute to cognitive decline beyond overt stroke.
CHD is associated with cognitive decline and higher burden of cerebral small vessel disease; microvascular dysfunction links heart and brain.
Control vascular risk factors per guideline-based CHD and AF management; cognitive benefits are plausible but not yet definitive.
Shared risk factors, inflammation, and microvascular dysfunction drive the heart-brain axis; cardiovascular trials should incorporate cognitive outcomes.
